@DarthParallax:

When you remove the last time counter from a suspended card, you cast it without paying its mana cost. So the opponent can counter it like any other spell. They can also use Nix on it. Actually, the Future Signt Pacts and cards with suspend were the reason for Nix's existence.

As for Rift Bolt itself, it's a perfect addition for red storm decks. Moreover, as has already been mentioned, by suspending it, you can quite often delay your opponent from casting a creature for a turn, which can be a really useful tempo advantage if you 're trying to combo FTW or if you're playing a con-trolling deck (pun intended).
